Speed Monitor

Automated internet speed monitoring for your organization. Track download, upload, latency, and WiFi metrics across all devices.

Automatic Tests

Runs every 10 minutes in the background

Menu Bar App

Live speeds at a glance

Real-time Dashboard

View org-wide stats and trends

WiFi Analytics

Signal strength, channel optimization

1 Requirements

macOS 12+

Monterey, Ventura, Sonoma, or later

Homebrew

Auto-installed if not present

2 One-Click Installation

Click the button below to download and run the installer. It will open Terminal automatically.

Download & Install

Downloaded! Now:

  1. Find the file in your Downloads folder: SpeedMonitor-Install.command
  2. Double-click the file to open Terminal and start installation
  3. If macOS blocks it: Right-click → Open → Click "Open" in the dialog
  4. Enter your email when prompted
Alternative: Copy command manually
Terminal
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hyperkishore/home-internet/main/dist/install.sh | bash

3 What Gets Installed

The installer will:

  • Install Homebrew (if not present)
  • Install speedtest-cli via Homebrew
  • Download speed_monitor.sh to ~/.local/bin/
  • Install SpeedMonitor.app to /Applications
  • Create launchd services (speed tests + menu bar)
  • Run first speed test immediately

4 Verify Installation

1

Look for the menu bar icon

You should see a speed icon in your menu bar showing download/upload speeds

2

Check service is running

Run launchctl list | grep speedmonitor

3

Check the dashboard

Your device should appear within a few minutes

5 Menu Bar App Setup (Optional)

To see your WiFi network name (SSID) in the dashboard, grant Location Services permission:

1

Click the menu bar icon

Look for the speed indicator in your menu bar

2

Go to Settings

Click "Settings" in the dropdown menu

3

Grant Permission

Click "Grant Permission" and allow Location Services when prompted

Why Location Services? macOS requires Location Services to read WiFi network names (a privacy feature). Your actual location is never tracked or stored.

6 Useful Commands

!

Run test manually

Click menu bar icon → "Run Speed Test" or ~/.local/bin/speed_monitor.sh

!

Update to latest version

Click menu bar icon → "Update App" or ~/.local/bin/speed_monitor.sh --update

!

View local logs

tail -20 ~/.local/share/nkspeedtest/speed_log.csv

!

Stop the service

launchctl unload ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.speedmonitor.plist

!

Restart the service

launchctl load ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.speedmonitor.plist

Ready to go?

After installation, visit the dashboard or your personal stats page
